name: RabbitAir
0:
”Alexa, turn on air purifier name”
”Alexa, set air purifier name fan speed to high”
”Alexa, set mode on air purifier name to auto”
skdetail:
Smart Home Skill. This skill may share device information with Amazon. Learn more.
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
des:
With the Rabbit Air skill and Alexa, you can now interact with your Rabbit Air WiFi enabled air purifiers by voice. To get started, select the 'Enable Skill' button in the Alexa App to link your Rabbit Air account and discover your devices. Find more information about connecting smart home devices at Connect a Smart Home Device to Alexa (http://tinyurl.com/alexa-smart-home).

When using the skill, you need established names for your air purifiers. There are two ways to define these names:
• Use the names you previously set up through the Rabbit Air app. You can also change them within the edit menu of the individual devices in the app.
• Inside the Alexa app, navigate to the devices and edit the selected device. (https://tinyurl.com/Alexa-device-name)

Once you have set the desired name for your devices, you can say the following:
• “Alexa, turn on [air purifier name]”
• “Alexa, set [air purifier name] fan speed to high”
• “Alexa, set mode on [air purifier name] to auto”

If you have any questions, please visit the Rabbit Air Alexa FAQ at https://www.rabbitair.com/pages/how-to-pair-with-alexa
